1.text: It is a luxurious thing, wine, and inebriation is tumultuous. Anyone who is delighted by this will not be wise.

2.text: Just like the roaring of a lion, so also is the dread of a king. Whoever provokes him sins in his own soul.

3.text: Honor is for the man who separates himself from contentions. But all the foolish meddle in altercations.

4.text: Because of the cold, the lazy one was not willing to plough. Therefore, in the summer, he will beg, and it will not be given to him.

5.text: Counsel in the heart of a man is like deep waters. But a wise man will draw it out.

6.text: Many men are called merciful. But who will find a faithful man?

7.text: The just who walks in his simplicity shall leave behind him blessed sons.

8.text: The king who sits on the throne of judgment scatters all evil with his gaze.

9.text: Who is able to say: “My heart is clean. I am pure from sin?”

10.text: Diverse weights, diverse measures: both are abominable with God.

11.text: A child may be understood by his interests: whether his works may be clean and upright.

12.text: The hearing ear and the seeing eye: the Lord has made them both.

13.text: Do not love sleep, lest deprivation oppress you. Open your eyes and be satisfied with bread.

14.text: “It is bad, it is bad,” says every buyer; and when he has withdrawn, then he will boast.

15.text: There is gold, and there are a multitude of jewels. But lips of knowledge are a precious vessel.

16.text: Take away the vestments of him who stands up to vouch for a stranger, and take a pledge from him instead of from outsiders.

17.text: The bread of lies is sweet to a man. But afterwards, his mouth will be filled with pebbles.

18.text: Plans are strengthened by counsels. And wars are to be handled by governments.

19.text: Do not become involved with him who reveals mysteries, and who walks deceitfully, and who enlarges his lips.

20.text: Whoever curses his father and mother, his lamp will be extinguished in the midst of darkness.

21.text: When an inheritance is obtained hastily in the beginning, in the end it will be without a blessing.

22.text: Do not say, “I will repay evil.” Wait for the Lord, and he will free you.

23.text: Diverse weights are an abomination with the Lord. A deceitful balance is not good.

24.text: The steps of men are directed by the Lord. But who is the man able to understand his own way?

25.text: It is ruin for a man to devour what is holy, or, after making vows, to retract them.

26.text: A wise king scatters the impious and bends an archway over them.

27.text: The spirit of a man is a lamp to the Lord, which investigates all the secrets of the inner self.

28.text: Mercy and truth guard the king, and his throne is strengthened by clemency.

29.text: The joy of youths is their strength. And the dignity of old men is their grey hairs.

30.text: The bruise of a wound, as well as scourges, shall wipe away evils in the more secret places of the inner self.
